intro: Calycogonium impressum, commonly known as the African star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its unique and decorative flowers. The plant features fleshy, succulent leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom profusely during the summer months.
